responsibilities: advise on how to change the existing products and design new ones so that they are scalable and relatively cheap to enhance
help choosing proper tools for specific problems
advise on how internal processes could be changed to ensure the products solve exactly the customer’s problems, the software runs fast and eliminate waste on unnecessary ceremonies
build a research lab to be used as a playground for software engineers to try out new tech
interface with an external IT service provider to support software engineers
results: an internal product that deals with fluid dynamics calculations has been redesigned from scratch in the form of a reactive system. This decision plays a crucial role both in how the system is being technically evolved and how the entire product is being managed nowadays
You are welcome to ask me for details
the rest of the products started slowly moving towards containerization ( Docker ) and Kubernetes on Microsoft Azure. Not a single one was containerized before

I gave a few technical presentations on architecture to my colleagues. It is pleasant to see how the de facto standards have been welcomed among the software engineers. I hope in the near future such knowledge sharing will become a regular routine in our department
The team has been switched to the trunk-base development — this has shorten the feedback loop considerably
Morning stand ups and predefined recurring meetings have been abandoned in favor of “live and on the spot communication”
The CI/CD pipeline made 100% automatic and would run new code on testing, then staging, and finally on the production environments without human interference
Production releases started to happen at least daily ( yes, even on Fridays )

The stakeholders were tightly involved into the development and release process — this has further shortened the feedback loop and allowed us to be sure we developed exactly what the stakeholders wanted

The back-end has been split into quite a few microservices using event-sourcing and CQRS — this has further shortened the feedback loop and made every single service tiny, easy to comprehend and test. As a side effect this has influenced security issues ( mostly authorization ) in the context of services

The angular and then react have been ditched from the front-end and substituted with SvelteKit — this ensured the front-end was as lightweight as possible and ran fast in the web browser and on mobile devices

HTTP methods have been substituted with websockets — this has simplified front-end — back-end communication enormously and ensured it was aligned with the rest of the system in terms of asynchronicity

All the messages were turned from JSON into binary strictly typed flatbuffers — this removed the necessity to parse messages and with timely corking in place ensured the communications ran almost at the native speed
TDD has been introduced to ensure the quality of the code and predictability of any possible changes
